definition: office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: What did he think was going on?
sentences.chinese: 他對時局演變的看法爲何？

sentences.english: The president was alarmed by the drift toward catastrophe in europe.
sentences.chinese: 總統對歐洲動盪的時局甚爲擔憂。

sentences.english: I believe as time moves on, the legacy of Zhu Rongji will become more obvious.
sentences.chinese: 相信隨着時局推移，朱熔基的價值和意義會更加凸顯。

sentences.english: There is, for instance, a self-deluding interpretation of the contemporary world situation.
sentences.chinese: 比如說有一些對當代世界時局自我欺騙式的闡釋。

sentences.english: Europe mustn't use tough times as an excuse to delay reform.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲不應該用時局不好來推遲改革的進行。

sentences.english: The current political situation was considered with a view to its causes and its effect.
sentences.chinese: 從原因和後果兩個方面對時局進行了考慮。

sentences.english: Yun-long sun criticism of the mood of the kuomintang (KMT) caused Lin Wu Yangs suspicions.
sentences.chinese: 孫雲龍對國民黨時局的批判引起了林午陽的懷疑。

definition: internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
